thread.title: Babysitter in jail for death of 8-month-old faces off with family
thread.title_full: Babysitter in jail for death of 8-month-old faces off with family | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: Babysitter in jail for death of 8-month-old faces off with family
text:
Family members of a woman who pleaded guilty in the death of an eight month old boy faced off with the infant’s family during an angry confrontation in a Pierce County courtroom.
Jamie Thompson, 35, was sentenced to nearly 8.5 years in prison for the death of 8-month-old Jayceon Thomas. She was babysitting the boy for his father in April 2014 when he died of what doctors determined was shaken baby syndrome.
“I’m sorry that baby Jayceon died,” Thompson wept when she spoke before sentencing.
Despite her guilty plea, Thompson still maintains her innocence.
She entered an Alford plea that allows a defendant to plead guilty without admitting to the crime, but because they believe the evidence would be enough for a jury to convict them.
Thompson agreed to plead guilty in exchange for a lighter sentence.
“I had nothing to do with it, and I don’t know how he died,” Thompson said. “I didn’t hurt him. I would never hurt him. I love him.”
Thompson has been held in the Pierce County jail since April 2014 and will get credit for the time she served behind bars.
